description.narrative: By end 2021, women, adolescents and mothers are empowered to access nutrition services, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2. By the end of 2021, adolescents, pregnant and breastfeeding women, mothers and children aged 0-5 years make greater use of quality nutritional services and adopt adequate nutrition and feeding practices in 15 provinces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, women, adolescents and mothers are empowered to access nutrition services

description.narrative: At the community level, the skills of 904 community health workers to promote essential nutrition actions within the community were strengthened through training. Partnerships with national and international NGOs for the implementation of community interventions focusing on the first 1000 days in the targeted provinces were also strengthened. The 2019 SMART survey, however, showed an overall decline in the level of mothers' knowledge of essential nutrition actions, from 41.2 per cent in 2018 to 29.3 per cent in 2019. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:09/02/2020
